bibl.title: Letter from [Thomas Welles] to Henry Rose Carter, August 4, 1920

div1.p: [Welles] invites Carter to serve as an expert on tropical diseases for the Paraguayan government.

div1.head: Letter from [Thomas Welles] to Henry Rose Carter, August 4, 1920
div1.opener:
ADDRESS OFFICIAL COMMUNICATIONS TO
THE SECRETARY OF STATE
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Paraguay
DEPARTMENT OF STATE
WASHINGTON
August 4, 1920.
Doctor Henry R. Carter,
In care of the Surgeon General,
Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Sir:
div1.p:
I am referred to you by Doctor Sherekewsky of the
Public Health Service, whom I had requested to suggest
an expert on tropical diseases whose services the Gov-
ernment of Paraguay desires to utilize.

I shall be glad to know whether you would consider
serving the Paraguayan Government and the conditions
relative to remuneration and appointment which you would
require.

Our Minister to Paraguay is in this country on leave
at present. Should you desire it, I shall be glad to ar-
range an interview for you with him when he returns to
Washington.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Thomas Welles
Acting Chief
Latin American Division The last name is Welles. I think
the first is Thomas, but I don't know,
L-
